q3.question: What kind of heroes did Tank and his crew become?

q4.question: What happens to Billy ?
q4.recall: Billy helps Zack with tank maintenance, goes on a tour of a work farm, is sentenced to three years of hard labor at the work farm, agrees to help Zack if the tank arrives, steers the tank off the road and starts across a muddy field, exits the tank to attach a cable while Sarah holds Buelton's gunmen at bay, and finally embraces Zack and Ladonna as they exit the tank while the crowd cheers.
q4.vectordb: Billy is taken to the county farm overnight as a precaution. He is later seen helping a work crew. Zack retrieves Billy by driving the tank over him and they escape together.
q4.hybrid: Billy helps Zack with tank maintenance, goes on a tour of a work farm, is sentenced to three years of hard labor at the work farm, agrees to help Zack if the tank arrives, steers the tank off the road and starts across a muddy field, exits the tank to attach a cable while Sarah holds Buelton's gunmen at bay, and finally embraces Zack and Ladonna as they exit the tank while the crowd cheers.

q9.question: Why can't Sheriff Buelton arrest CSM Carey?
q9.recall: Sheriff Buelton cannot arrest CSM Carey because CSM Carey is a military personnel and therefore falls under the jurisdiction of the military, not the local law enforcement.
q9.vectordb: Sheriff Buelton cannot arrest CSM Carey because of the Posse Comitatus Act, which prohibits the Army from rendering aid in a civilian matter without the permission of the President of the United States. Buelton misinterprets the term and takes offense, thinking he has been called a "pussy communist."
